TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi abstract sealed beforefieldinit XamlLanguage extends System.Object
public ref class XamlLanguage abstract sealed

Docs.summary: Defines constants that provide strings or objects that are useful for XAML markup or for programming with XAML types. These strings or objects are relevant to XAML language concepts, to the implementation of XAML language concepts in .NET Framework XAML Services, or to both.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Xaml.XamlLanguage> API returns lookup results that are based on a XAML schema context that remains internal. In this schema context, <xref:System.Xaml.XamlSchemaContext.SupportMarkupExtensionsWithDuplicateArity%2A> is `true`. Otherwise, the XAML schema context that is reported as the default for .NET Framework XAML Services and its defined XAML readers and XAML writers uses default settings. Overall, the XAML schema context that is used for predefined XAML readers and XAML writers is based on the same <xref:System.Xaml.XamlSchemaContext> instance that is available from APIs that set or return a <xref:System.Xaml.XamlSchemaContext>. The default XAML schema context for .NET Framework XAML Services is based on CLR concepts and reflection. Evidence of the default CLR backing can be found when obtaining certain <xref:System.Xaml.XamlLanguage> properties that are a <xref:System.Xaml.XamlType> and when checking <xref:System.Xaml.XamlType.UnderlyingType%2A>. Similarly, <xref:System.Xaml.XamlLanguage> properties that are a <xref:System.Xaml.XamlMember> have CLR reflection-based values for <xref:System.Xaml.XamlMember.UnderlyingMember%2A>.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Shared ReadOnly Property AllDirectives As ReadOnlyCollection(Of XamlDirective)

Docs.summary: Gets a read-only generic collection of each identifier that is defined by .NET Framework XAML Services.
Docs.value: A read-only generic collection of each identifier that is defined by .NET Framework XAML Services.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Shared ReadOnly Property AllTypes As ReadOnlyCollection(Of XamlType)

Docs.summary: Gets a read-only generic collection of individual values that match, or alias, a XAML language intrinsic that is defined by .NET Framework XAML Services.
Docs.value: A read-only generic collection of each that matches a XAML language intrinsic.

remarks.format: ## Remarks See [[MS-XAML] Section 5.2](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=114525) for a list of intrinsic XAML language information items. Note that not all items that are listed as subsections of 5.2 are implemented as a <xref:System.Xaml.XamlType>. For example, `x:Code` is not a type.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Shared ReadOnly Property Arguments As XamlDirective
public: static property System::Xaml::XamlDirective ^ Arguments { System::Xaml::XamlDirective ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets a for the of a factory method or a generic usage.
Docs.value: A for the of a factory method or generic usage.

remarks.format:
## Remarks A factory method is a [!INCLUDE[xaml2009](~/includes/xaml2009-md.md)] feature for identifying an alternative technique that constructs the underlying type for a XAML type. The `Arguments` specify the input of a factory method and enable specifying that information in markup. The default techniques, in absence of a factory method, are to attempt to find a default constructor and then attempt to find an identified type converter for type, member, or destination type.
For the generic usage, the `Arguments` wrap the objects or initialization text of all construction inputs that are specified as necessary for the `TypeArguments`.

remarks.format: ## Remarks A factory method is a [!INCLUDE[xaml2009](~/includes/xaml2009-md.md)] feature for identifying an alternative technique that constructs the underlying type for a XAML type. The default technique, if a factory method is unavailable, is to try to find a default constructor, and then try to find an identified type converter on type, member, or destination type.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Shared ReadOnly Property Initialization As XamlDirective
public: static property System::Xaml::XamlDirective ^ Initialization { System::Xaml::XamlDirective ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets a for the directive from XAML.
Docs.value: A for the directive from XAML.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This directive represents the XAML node or XAML information set representation of initialization text, where a string within an object element supplies the type construction information for the surrounding object element.
If you are looking at raw node interpretations or visualizations, `Initialization` is sometimes seen in string form as `_Initialization` (note the leading underscore) and is within the XAML language XAML namespace (as notated by a preceding `Namespace` node). In [MS-XAML], this concept is described under the heading `x:InitializationText`. See [[MS-XAML] Section 5.3.3](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=114525).

Docs.summary: Gets a for the directive from XAML.
Docs.value: A for the directive from XAML.

remarks.format:
## Remarks An `Items` directive is a node representation wrapper around multiple object values within a surrounding object. See [[MS-XAML] Section 5.3.1](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=114525).
If you examine raw XAML node stream interpretations or visualizations, `Items` is sometimes seen in string form as `_Items` (note the leading underscore) and is within the XAML language XAML namespace (as notated by a preceding `Namespace` node).

remarks.format: ## Remarks A `Key` directive is used for objects in a dictionary. See [[MS-XAML] Section 5.3.5](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=114525).

Docs.summary: Gets a for the type that is the item type of .
Docs.value: A for the type that is the item type of .

remarks.format: ## Remarks In the .NET Framework XAML Services implementation, the `Member` <xref:System.Xaml.XamlType> is backed by <xref:System.Windows.Markup.MemberDefinition?displayProperty=nameWithType>.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Shared ReadOnly Property Members As XamlDirective
public: static property System::Xaml::XamlDirective ^ Members { System::Xaml::XamlDirective ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets a for the concept in XAML.
Docs.value: A for the concept in XAML.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The `Members` concept is not specifically defined in [MS-XAML]. `Members` is a concept for defining members of types in markup itself, as opposed to referencing backing types. For more information, see <xref:System.Windows.Markup.PropertyDefinition>.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Shared ReadOnly Property Name As XamlDirective
public: static property System::Xaml::XamlDirective ^ Name { System::Xaml::XamlDirective ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets a for the directive from XAML.
Docs.value: A for the directive from XAML.

remarks.format:
## Remarks A `Name` directive is used for identifiers of objects in markup. See [[MS-XAML] Section 5.3.4](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=114525).
Although this concept of `Name` is not completely consistent with the use that is specified in [MS-XAML], you can typically use the `Name` directive or the `Name` attribute to provide a conceptual connection between XAML objects in markup and the run-time representations that are created by XAML processing of the markup. This use depends on how specific frameworks implement their programming models to integrate XAML into their general object models. For more information, see [x:Name Directive](~/docs/framework/xaml-services/x-name-directive.md).

MemberSignature.Value: Public Shared ReadOnly Property Null As XamlType
public: static property System::Xaml::XamlType ^ Null { System::Xaml::XamlType ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets a for the or XAML language intrinsic.
Docs.value: A for the / XAML language intrinsic.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This XAML type provides null values for object values in markup. The XAML type is (or must be) assignable to `MarkupExtension`. See [[MS-XAML] Section 5.2.4](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=114525).

MemberSignature.Value: Public Shared ReadOnly Property Object As XamlType
public: static property System::Xaml::XamlType ^ Object { System::Xaml::XamlType ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets a for the XAML language concept.
Docs.value: A for the XAML language concept.

remarks.format: ## Remarks XAML specifies `x:Object` as a special language concept. See [[MS-XAML] Section 5.2.5](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=114525).

MemberSignature.Value: Public Shared ReadOnly Property PositionalParameters As XamlDirective
public: static property System::Xaml::XamlDirective ^ PositionalParameters { System::Xaml::XamlDirective ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets a for the directive from XAML.
Docs.value: A for the directive from XAML.

remarks.format:
## Remarks `PositionalParameters` is a directive that wraps the multiple objects that can be specified as a set of object nodes for input of a markup extension. See [[MS-XAML] Section 6.6.7](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=114525).
If you are looking at raw node interpretations or visualizations, `PositionalParameters` is sometimes seen in string form as `_PositionalParameters` (note the leading underscore) and is within the XAML language XAML namespace (as notated by a preceding `Namespace` node).

MemberSignature.Value: Public Shared ReadOnly Property Property As XamlType
public: static property System::Xaml::XamlType ^ Property { System::Xaml::XamlType ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets a for the concept in XAML.
Docs.value: A for the concept in XAML.

remarks.format: ## Remarks `Property` is a specialized form of the XAML type that is identified as <xref:System.Xaml.XamlLanguage.Member%2A>.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Shared ReadOnly Property Reference As XamlType
public: static property System::Xaml::XamlType ^ Reference { System::Xaml::XamlType ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets a that represents a for XAML.
Docs.value: A that represents a for XAML.

remarks.format: ## Remarks `Reference` is a [!INCLUDE[xaml2009](~/includes/xaml2009-md.md)] feature for referencing another object node in the markup. The implementation for .NET Framework XAML Services is found in <xref:System.Windows.Markup.Reference?displayProperty=nameWithType>.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Shared ReadOnly Property Shared As XamlDirective
public: static property System::Xaml::XamlDirective ^ Shared { System::Xaml::XamlDirective ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets a for the directive for XAML.
Docs.value: A for the directive for XAML.

remarks.format: ## Remarks A `Shared` directive (when it is set to `true`) specifies that when an item is found in a dictionary, references to the object should always return the singleton instead of a new instance. This behavior is related to the concept that a dictionary might be used as a source for a shared content or template mechanism by particular frameworks that use XAML. `Shared` is not specified in [MS-XAML] but is part of the `x` namespace-defined behavior for XAML in WPF and .NET Framework version 3.0 and version 3.5.

public: static property System::Xaml::XamlType ^ Single { System::Xaml::XamlType ^ get(); };

Docs.value: A for the XAML language intrinsic.

remarks.format: ## Remarks See [[MS-XAML] Section 5.2.8](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=114525).

MemberSignature.Value: Public Shared ReadOnly Property Static As XamlType
public: static property System::Xaml::XamlType ^ Static { System::Xaml::XamlType ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets a for the / XAML language intrinsic.
Docs.value: A for the / XAML language intrinsic.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This XAML type provides values for markup where the backing member is a static member. The XAML type is (or must be) assignable to `MarkupExtension`. See [[MS-XAML] Section 5.2.2](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=114525).

MemberSignature.Value: Public Shared ReadOnly Property String As XamlType
public: static property System::Xaml::XamlType ^ String { System::Xaml::XamlType ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets a for the XAML language intrinsic.
Docs.value: A for the XAML language intrinsic.

remarks.format: ## Remarks See [[MS-XAML] Section 5.2.6](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=114525).

MemberSignature.Value: Public Shared ReadOnly Property Subclass As XamlDirective
public: static property System::Xaml::XamlDirective ^ Subclass { System::Xaml::XamlDirective ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets a for the directive from XAML.
Docs.value: A for the directive from XAML.

remarks.format: ## Remarks See [[MS-XAML] Section 5.3.8](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=114525)

MemberSignature.Value: Public Shared ReadOnly Property SynchronousMode As XamlDirective
public: static property System::Xaml::XamlDirective ^ SynchronousMode { System::Xaml::XamlDirective ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets a that enables loading XAML asynchronously if the XAML processor supports such a mode.
Docs.value: A that enables loading XAML asynchronously.

remarks.format: ## Remarks A `SynchronousMode` directive (when set to `Async`) is used to specify that when a XAML file is loaded, the root node is processed first. The resulting object can be inserted even though its content is still processing. In this mode you can bypass the default XAML processing behavior of working from deepest node to the root. In the default processing logic for XAML, any caller that is waiting for the root object is blocked until the full parse is complete. `SynchronousMode` is not specified in [MS-XAML] but is part of the `x` namespace-defined behavior for XAML in WPF beginning in .NET Framework version 3.5 with SP1 (or any subsequent service pack).

MemberSignature.Value: Public Shared ReadOnly Property TimeSpan As XamlType
public: static property System::Xaml::XamlType ^ TimeSpan { System::Xaml::XamlType ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets a for the concept in XAML language.
Docs.value: A for the XAML language concept.

remarks.format: ## Remarks See [[MS-XAML] Section 5.2.16](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=114525). `TimeSpan` is not a true intrinsic, but was specified in the XAML specification because it is a commonly used type. The XAML specification authors considered it useful to standardize the XAML representation in derived vocabularies. See also [Built-in Types for Common XAML Language Primitives](~/docs/framework/xaml-services/built-in-types-for-common-xaml-language-primitives.md).

MemberSignature.Value: Public Shared ReadOnly Property Type As XamlType
public: static property System::Xaml::XamlType ^ Type { System::Xaml::XamlType ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets a for the / XAML language intrinsic.
Docs.value: A for the / XAML language intrinsic.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This XAML type provides <xref:System.Xaml.XamlType> values that use bindings from, and lookups to, a backing type system. The XAML type is (or must be) assignable to `MarkupExtension`. See [[MS-XAML] Section 5.2.3](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=114525).

MemberSignature.Value: Public Shared ReadOnly Property TypeArguments As XamlDirective
public: static property System::Xaml::XamlDirective ^ TypeArguments { System::Xaml::XamlDirective ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets a for the directive from XAML.
Docs.value: A for the directive from XAML.

remarks.format: ## Remarks A `TypeArguments` directive specifies the type constraints of a generic when a generic is specified as a XAML object. See [[MS-XAML] Section 5.3.11](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=114525).

MemberSignature.Value: Public Shared ReadOnly Property Uid As XamlDirective
public: static property System::Xaml::XamlDirective ^ Uid { System::Xaml::XamlDirective ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets a for the directive from XAML.
Docs.value: A for the directive from XAML.

remarks.format: ## Remarks A `Uid` directive specifies a unique identifier for a XAML markup element. Strictly speaking, such a unique identifier could be applied to several purposes within a XAML-implementing framework. `Uid` differs from `Name` in that `Name` has a specific role in the [MS-XAML] definition for declaring the identifiers that exist in an object graph output from a XAML source, whereas `Uid` has no specific role. In the existing XAML-implementing frameworks that use .NET Framework XAML Services, `Uid` is typically used for localization purposes. See [[MS-XAML] Section 5.3.6](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=114525).

MemberSignature.Value: Public Shared ReadOnly Property UnknownContent As XamlDirective
public: static property System::Xaml::XamlDirective ^ UnknownContent { System::Xaml::XamlDirective ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets a for the directive from XAML.
Docs.value: A for the directive from XAML.

remarks.format:
## Remarks `UnknownContent` is a directive that is a placeholder to use in a XAML node set if a reader encounters unknown content for a value node or initialization text (no available intrinsic or text syntax can convert it).
If you are looking at raw node interpretations or visualizations, `UnknownContent` is sometimes seen in string form as `_UnknownContent` (note the leading underscore) and is within the XAML language XAML namespace (as notated by a preceding `Namespace` node).

MemberSignature.Value: Public Shared ReadOnly Property Uri As XamlType
public: static property System::Xaml::XamlType ^ Uri { System::Xaml::XamlType ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets a for the XAML language concept.
Docs.value: A for the XAML language concept.

remarks.format: ## Remarks See [[MS-XAML] Section 5.2.15](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=114525). `Uri` is not a true intrinsic but was specified in the XAML specification because it is a frequently used type. The XAML specification authors considered it useful to standardize the XAML representation in derived vocabularies. See also [Built-in Types for Common XAML Language Primitives](~/docs/framework/xaml-services/built-in-types-for-common-xaml-language-primitives.md).

Docs.summary: Gets a string value for the string that identifies the XAML (2006) language namespace. That namespace corresponds to the XAML (2006) "x" prefixed namespace as defined in [[MS-XAML] Section 5.1.1](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=114525).

Docs.summary: Gets a collection of the namespace identifiers for XAML.
Docs.value: A collection of the namespace identifiers for XAML.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Currently this collection contains only the <xref:System.Xaml.XamlLanguage.Xaml2006Namespace> value.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Shared ReadOnly Property XData As XamlType
public: static property System::Xaml::XamlType ^ XData { System::Xaml::XamlType ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets a for the XAML type that backs an block in XAML.
Docs.value: The for the XAML type that backs an block. See [[MS-XAML] Section 5.2.23](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=114525).

Docs.summary: Gets a string value for the string that identifies the XML (1998) language namespace. That namespace corresponds to the XML "xml" prefixed namespace as referenced in [[MS-XAML] Section 5.1.2](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=114525).

Attribute.AttributeName: get: System.Runtime.TargetedPatchingOptOut("Performance critical to inline this type of method across NGen image boundaries")

Docs.summary: Gets a collection of the namespace identifiers for XML.
Docs.value: A collection of the namespace identifiers for XML.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Currently this collection contains only the <xref:System.Xaml.XamlLanguage.Xml1998Namespace> value.
